This F430 Spider has 24k miles and is offered in California with a car cover, manufacturer’s literature and accessories, and a clean Montana title.

Exterior details include a power-operated soft top, xenon headlights, Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, parking sensors, and quad exhaust tips flanking the rear diffuser. A November 2019 entry on the Carfax report states “very minor damage” was reported. The selling dealer adds that the front bumper has been refinished, and the front valance was repaired in preparation for the sale.

The 19″ split-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 225/35 front and 285/35 rear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. Silver-finished Brembo brake calipers are fitted over cross-drilled and ventilated rotors at all four corners. The brake fluid was flushed in 2021.

The power-adjustable Daytona-style seats are upholstered in Blu Scuro leather with contrasting stitching and embossed Cavallino Rampante logos on the headrests. Carbon-fiber trim accents the cabin, which has automatic climate control, aluminum pedals, and a CD stereo.

The three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with an engine-start button as well as a manettino dial for selecting dynamic settings.
